answers.answer: Hi Heter, sorry about the neuropathy. I do understand there are some things to treat it and so I would consult with your endo. But yes, it is caused by high blood sugar over a prolonged period of time (You don't say how long you've been Type 1). What I do want to say is that studies show that diabetic complications begin with blood sugars over 140 so you should look at that more as a limit to strive for rather than 200. Good luck with you on finding treatment for your neuropathy. I do know it makes it important to care for and regularly inspect your feet because you can have damage, sores, etc and not realize it due to numbness.Zoe

question: Have adult diabetes type1.  Suger levels very rarely go over 200 yet I have aquired neroupathy in my feet really bad.  Am doing everything I know how to do and it won`t go away.  Is there other reasons, other than high sugar levels that cause neroupathy?  It`s driving me nut`so!  lol... Please help!P.S.  Can`t excerise right now cause of left hip.  Going to have hip replacement on Jan 5th.  Then can excerise, which from what I understand, will help. ???
title: Neroupathy
